## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r describe, fig.width=8, fig.height=11, message=FALSE}
# create dataset with dummy factor
iris %>%
  mutate(
    `I am a factor with very long variable-name` = factor(
      sample(1:4, nrow(iris), replace = TRUE),
      labels = c("hi", "ho", "xXx", "I am a level with long level-name")
    )
  ) ->
df_iris_test



# describe data frame
df_iris_test %>%
  describr(
    by = Species, 
    pvalues = TRUE,
    theme_new = theme_default(text_size = 9) # unit: pt
  ) %>%
  describe_if(
    is.numeric,
    with = list(
      dscr_mean_sd(),
      dscr_median_q1_q3(),
      dscr_min_max(),
      dscr_histogram()
    )
  ) %>%
  describe_if(
    is.factor,
    with = list(dscr_freq(), dscr_factor_barchart())
  ) %>%
  fit_to_size()
```
